means: 小船，小艇( boat的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: He'd spent his boyhood summers mucking about in boats.
sentence.Network_cn: 他小时候，夏天都是在船上浑打胡闹度过的。

sentence.Network_en: Sailing boats lay at anchor in the narrow waterway.
sentence.Network_cn: 帆船停泊在狭窄的水道上。

sentence.Network_en: There are many boats, new and used, for sale.
sentence.Network_cn: 有很多新旧不一的船待售。

PerfectNetExp.abs: the Galapagos Islands , a prime target for unlicensed hunting , has few practicable landing spots for boats and passages through the volcanic-rock landscape .又如，加拉帕哥斯群岛是非法打猎的一个主要目标，这个岛屿上很少有船只的着陆点与穿越火山岩地带的通道。

little boats were picking up passengers .小船也正忙着接送乘客。
they skim past like boats of papyrus , like eagles swooping down on their prey .我的日子过去如快船，如急落抓食的鹰。

entry.def: A boat is something in which people can travel across water.

example.ex: One of the best ways to see the area is in a small boat...
example.tran: 游览该地区的一个最好方式是乘坐小船。

example.ex: The island may be reached by boat from the mainland.
example.tran: 这个岛屿可以从大陆乘小船到达。

entry.def: You can refer to a passenger ship as a boat .

example.ex: When the boat reached Cape Town, we said a temporary goodbye.
example.tran: 客轮到达开普敦时，我们暂时分别。

entry.def: If you say that someone has missed the boat, you mean that they have missed an opportunity and may not get another.

entry.tran: （尤指为了庆祝）挥金如土，大事铺张
entry.def: If you push the boat out, you spend a lot of money on something, especially in order to celebrate.

example.ex: I earn enough to push the boat out now and again.
example.tran: 我挣的钱足以时不时摆摆阔了。

entry.def: If you say that someone is rocking the boat, you mean that they are upsetting a calm situation and causing trouble.

example.ex: I said I didn't want to rock the boat in any way.
example.tran: 我说过我根本不想挑事。

entry.tran: 处于相同的倒霉境地；同病相怜
entry.def: If two or more people are in the same boat, they are in the same unpleasant situation.

auth_sentence.content: Others expect a rising tide that lifts all boats.

auth_sentence.content: Norse Vikings whose dragon boats preyed on the coasts.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Norse Vikings whose dragon boats preyed on the coasts.

Sentence.sentence: It is the most prominent example of a huge new "sharing economy", in which people rent beds, cars, boats and other assets directly from each other, co-ordinated via the internet.
